definition: to have become common practice (idiom)/to become a general trend
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: In Asia and America it has become fashionable to look upon these failings with disdain.
sentences.chinese: 在亞洲和美國，不屑一顧於歐洲的衰落已經蔚然成風。

sentences.english: Whatever the case is, ads planted in TV dramas and films are the order of the day.
sentences.chinese: 不論怎麼說，在影視劇中植入廣告現已蔚然成風。

sentences.english: Cooperation and mutual help between factories has become the order of the day.
sentences.chinese: 廠際協作和互相幫助已蔚然成風。

sentences.english: To improve one's professional skill has now become a common practice.
Co-ordination and mutual help between factories has become the order of the day.
sentences.chinese: 廠際協作和互相幫助已蔚然成風。

sentences.english: The construction of urban and rural public sports and exercise facilities was accelerated, and the national fitness program has taken root.
sentences.chinese: 城鄉公共體育設施建設加快，全民健身活動蔚然成風。

sentences.english: This has become a fairly common practice.
sentences.chinese: 這種做法已經蔚然成風。

sentences.english: and apparently irrational financial behavior becomes the order of the day.
sentences.chinese: 而很顯然，不合理的財務行爲蔚然成風。

sentences.english: Participation in standardization work in PUYUAN prevail.
sentences.chinese: 參與標準化工作在濮院蔚然成風。

sentences.english: I hope equality of opportunity for men and women is here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 我希望男女機會平等的風氣能夠蔚然成風。

sentences.english: Coordination and mutual help between factories have become the order of the day.
sentences.chinese: 廠際協作和互相幫助已蔚然成風。
